intro: Onosma hispanica, commonly known as Spanish broom, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. Onosma hispanica is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
